 After collapse of the US stock market in 1929, Germany (who had built their sometime successful post-WW1 economic recovery on US capital and loans) experienced severe economic hardships through 1932, including unemployment of 25%. Gobbels structured Hitler's image as the 'savior' of German industry and national pride (Treaty of Versailles and reparations). Hitler, a powerful public speaker, was able to convince the public he could deliver prosperity to all classes, including landowners, workers and industrialists, while thwarting the powerful communist threat (which was combined with the Jews beginning the racial theme). Votes were tallied and Hindenburg capitulated. 
 
 In 1933 Hitler suspended the German Constitution, abolished state legislatures and outlawed all but the Nazi Party, providing him with complete and absolute control of Germany. At that point, not a few years but one brief year, you could have been the brightest, most forward thinking adult German in the world, not a child or young adult, but knowing right from wrong would have offered you the choice of keeping your mouth shut about wrong or a 3AM visit from your friendly Gestapo.
